intro: Haloragis lanceolata, commonly known as the narrow-leaved starburry, is a flowering plant native to Australia. It is a perennial herb that typically grows in wetland or swampy environments. The plant features slender, lance-shaped leaves and produces small, star-shaped yellow flowers. It is often found in coastal areas and is adapted to saline conditions. Haloragis lanceolata plays a role in stabilizing soil and providing habitat for various aquatic and terrestrial organisms.
